claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
Type I interferon response score (normalized units) 3.1 [compared to] 1.0

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination improves tumor visibility to T cells by broadening the peptide repertoire on MHC-I.

evidence.quote: A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.
Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome 62.3% [compared to] 37.3%

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccine sensitizes tumors to anti-PD-L1 therapy.

evidence.quote: Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.
Retrospective human survival comparison p-value p=0.01

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination increases PD-L1 pathway activity and CD8+ T-cell infiltration.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue 2.4x [compared to] 1.0x
Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change 1.8x [compared to] 1.0x

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.
